message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.UE, cs.CY 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it focuses on natural language processing and sequence modeling. The use of bidirectional recurrent neural networks with an attention mechanism over embedded question-response pairs is a common technique in this field. 

It is also likely to belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) as the paper discusses the use of machine learning in intelligent tutoring systems and the development of a neural pedagogical agent. 

cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another possible sub-category as the paper deals with the development of an intelligent agent for mobile education applications. 

cs.UE (Ubiquitous Computing) is a possible sub-category as the paper discusses the deployment of intelligent tutoring systems on mobile applications, which are a ubiquitous computing platform. 

Finally, cs.CY (Computers and Society) is a possible sub-category as the paper discusses the development of an interpretable education platform that addresses issues such as varied user attention and problem exhaustion.
